meanings.definition: Do wrong or commit an offense.
meanings.sent1: I never misdo my homework because I want to do well in school.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misdo others and always treat them with kindness.
meanings.sent3: Tommy promised not to misdo his chores, but he ended up playing video games instead.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to misdo the rules of gravity as it effortlessly leaped from the table to the counter.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of misdoing can lead to serious trouble and regret.

meanings.sent1: Even though he knew it was wrong, John couldn't help but misdo by taking the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to teach children not to misdo and to always be respectful to others.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy continued to misdo by chewing on the furniture despite being scolded.
meanings.sent4: Her actions seemed to misdo the harmony of the group, causing tension among the members.
meanings.sent5: The students were warned that any attempt to misdo during the exam would result in immediate disqualification.
